articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan said India fired missiles at three air bases early on Saturday including one close to the capital, Islamabad, but Pakistani air defences intercepted most of them as the neighbours extended their worst fighting in nearly three decades.
articles.title: Pakistan says three air bases targeted by Indian missiles

articles.author: Marina Bobrova, Dmitry Antonov, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed direct talks with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul that he said should be aimed at achieving a durable peace and eliminating the root causes of the war.
articles.title: Putin proposes direct peace talks with Ukraine after three years of war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's vice premier He Lipeng held talks with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent early on Saturday in Geneva, China's state-owned news agency Xinhua reported.
articles.title: China-US trade talks begin in Geneva

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Ukraine and European leaders agreed on Saturday to an unconditional 30-day ceasefire on May 12 with the backing of U.S. President Donald Trump, threatening President Vladimir Putin with new "massive" sanctions if he failed to comply.
articles.title: Europe leaders, in Kyiv, turn up pressure on Russia over ceasefire

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci, Edward Mcallister
articles.description: Albania holds parliamentary elections on Sunday in which prime minister Edi Rama is seeking an unprecedented fourth term in office after a campaign dominated by promises to join the European Union and accusations of widespread graft.
articles.title: Albania votes as PM Rama seeks fourth term

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV took his first trip outside the Vatican on Saturday, heading about an hour's drive east of Rome to the small Italian town of Genazzano to visit a shrine to the Virgin Mary.
articles.title: Pope Leo visits shrine near Rome on first trip outside Vatican as pontiff

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Saturday that if the United States' goal is to deprive Iran of its "nuclear rights", Tehran will never back down over those rights.
articles.title: Iran will not back down from nuclear rights, foreign minister says

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: The British government outlined plans on Sunday to end what it called the "failed free market experiment" in mass immigration by restricting skilled worker visas to graduate-level jobs and forcing businesses to increase training for local workers.
articles.title: UK plans to end 'failed free market experiment' in immigration

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Jonathan Saul, David Ljunggren
articles.description: The delivery of the Fath-360 launchers - if it occurs - would help support Russia's grinding assault on its neighbor and reaffirm the deepening security ties between Moscow and Tehran.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran to send Russia launchers for short-range missiles, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey is ready to undertake the duty to observe a possible ceasefire in Ukraine, its foreign minister said during a "coalition of the willing" call with Kyiv's partners on Saturday, a Turkish foreign ministry source said.
articles.title: Turkey ready to undertake duty for observing potential ceasefire in Ukraine, source says
